entry.title: gpu: Fail EstablishGpuChannel if GPU process returns invalid mojo handle
entry.content:
GpuClient::OnEstablishGpuChannel has a DCHECK that asserts that if the

status is kSuccess, the channel mojo handle must also be valid. However,

there's nothing that really guarantees this - GpuServiceImpl can return

an empty handle for transient errors and GpuHostImpl will just pass that

along to GpuClient with a kSuccess status. This CL makes it so that

GpuHostImpl passes a kGpuHostInvalid status if the handle is invalid,

which should make the client retry establishing a GPU channel.



Bug: 40073631

Change-Id: I67b146ff306f0f16a12877ea9e2a3fd410e3ed07

entry.title: carrier_lock: Use real model name if possible + fixes
entry.content:
Fixes:

1. The InvalidTimestamp error need to be ignored because the modem

accepts only newer configurations and we have to apply the same

config on every boot.

2. Provisioning service sometimes responds with older config after it

sends notification through FCM. Added delay to workaround this race.

3. Fix possible crashes when FCM notification comes at the wrong time.

4. Prevent manager from missing a configuration update when FCM

notification is received before the notification handler is initialized.



Bug: b:324322719

entry.title: [Blink] Optimize additions of options to <select>
entry.content:
Addition of N options to a with size

greater than 1, it has no effect on the selected state as per the HTML

spec. This change ensures that we do not call ResetToDefaultSelection()

in that case.



Addition of 25,000 options takes ~400ms after this change (which took

~12s earlier).



HTML spec: https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/form-elements.html#selectedness-setting-algorithm

Test page: https://jsbin.com/muwacasuwe/edit?html,js,output



Bug: 1094911

entry.title: Unify platform calls to snapshot utilities
entry.content:
These two files only are used on the desktop.



For the Mac, snapshotting happens at the window level, so the

difference between `GetContentNativeView()` and `GetNativeView()` is

irrelevant. For Windows and Aura, the implementations of

`ui::GrabWindowSnapshotAsync()` and `ui::GrabViewSnapshotAsync()` are

identical.

entry.title: [Tab Group] TabModelJniBridge#hasOtherRelatedTabs -> isTabInTabGroup
entry.content:
In the effort of supporting tab groups with a single tab we are

migrating from hasOtherRelatedTabs to isTabInTabGroup.

hasOtherRelatedTabs does not make sense for tab groups with a single

tab. This CL migrates TabModelJniBridge and related places.



Until the flag for the migration AndroidTabGroupStableIds is enabled

isTabInTabGroup has the same meaning as hasOtherRelatedTabs. Once

enabled isTabInTabGroup checks for the presence of the new stable

tab group ID only assigned to "real" tab groups as opposed to

hasOtherRelatedTabs which checked if the group contained at least

two tabs.



Bug: b/41496693

Change-Id: I66b65e66bada41529df2eb44a1789ceca50c77d7

text pastes. Other kinds of paste have new fields in the struct.

entry.title: IDB: refactor some test code.
entry.content:
MockFailureInjector is a mojom interface used by browser tests to

simulate backing store failures. In this CL, the LevelDB specific

version is changed from a singleton on the main IDB sequence to an

instance on the bucket sequence because:



a) it needs to be accessed from the bucket sequence (only)

b) IndexedDBContextImpl shouldn't know about level DB

c) singletons are bad, even though they do save on plumbing



Bug: 40279485

entry.title: desk_profiles: crosapi changes to pass profile id when loading favicons
entry.content:
In the ChromeOS saved desk library, favicons are shown for saved desks

that contain browsers (which would be most of them). The favicons are

currently loaded using the "active" profile, which doesn't work well for

the simple reason that the profile might not have visited the site.



This CL contains the crosapi changes to allow ash to pass a lacros

profile ID over to lacros. The lacros-side changes are complete. The ash

side changes are minimal and only enough to compile. The actual ash side

changes to pass profile IDs will be in an upcoming CL.



BUG=b:322847219

entry.title: 'writingsuggestions' content attribute should reflect the given value
entry.content:
In CL:5247315, we set the content attribute to values 'true'/'false'

during the IDL setter. However, it was raised in spec dicussions that

the content attribute should just reflect the value set by the IDL

setter to match the default reflection logic of enumerated attributes.



E.g. when setting element.writingSuggestions = "invalid-value"



Previously:

getAttribute("writingsuggestions") == "true"



Now:

getAttribute("writingsuggestions") == "invalid-value"



Bug: 1513953

entry.title: Fix renderer crash on opening FileSettings du to oracle mismatch
entry.content:
Due to a oracle mismatch between here [1] and here [2], the mojo pipe

is created on one side which is not matched on the other. This CL keeps

entry.title: UKM iOS: skip URL recording on NavigationContext reuse
entry.content:
We've seen a few DCHECK crashes specifically on iOS related to URL recording for navigation. In particular, it looks from the user action stack trace that it is caused by the user going back to a historical entry via action "MobileToolbarBack", and the NavigationContext is reused. The doc string on WebStateObserver::DidFinishNavigation says "`navigation_context` will be destroyed at the end of this call, so the reuse sounds like a data quality bug, and I don't know about navigation on iOS how that action should be handled. Adding an if-check on the UKM side so that we don't try to repeat associating an URL to the same source id, which triggers an error.



Bug: b/40075835

entry.title: blink: minor tweaks to form related classes
entry.content:
Specifically:

. A couple of places in TextControlElement have code like:

UpdatePlaceholderText();

HTMLElement* placeholder = PlaceholderElement();

This changes UpdatePlaceholderText() to return the element,

so that code becomes:

HTMLElement* placeholder = UpdatePlaceholderText();

. Moves SuggestedValue().empty() to front of

PlaceholderShouldBeVisible as it's the cheapest check.

. Makes EnsureInnerEditorElement() non-virtual and checks

field before calling to virtual function to create editor.

. Moves CreateShadowSubtree to virtual, as it shouldn't be

necessary to call outside of subclasses.

. Removes InputTypeView::EnsureInnerEditorElement as it's

covered by other functions.

entry.title: [A11y settings] Redirect to manage a11y page in kiosk mode
entry.content:
The os_a11y_subpage has too many escape routes to be used in

Kiosk mode. Always redirect to the old manage_a11y_subpage in

this case. Eventually we'll need to get rid fo the old subpage,

but for now this should prevent escape to full os-settings.



In addition this change makes it possible for users to get

back to switch access settings after turning on the feature.

Previously the settings were hidden, so after initial

configuration it wasn't to get back again. Note initial launch

crbug.com/1174830 shows SA is meant to work normally in kiosk.



Since users can turn on SA from the floating accessibility

menu, this doesn't cause any access changes. However, this

makes b/325629734 apply to switch access as well, but that

seems P2 while the bug this fixes is P1.



Bug: b:324870294,b:325629734

Test: Existing, manual: cannot reach full os-settings, can access SA settings

entry.title: Add form submission test where initiator immediately closes
entry.content:
This test covers a case that we will need to support in order to use a

PolicyContainerHost based solution for SiteInstanceGroup, to keep

navigation objects alive longer than their corresponding

RenderFrameHost.



In this test, a main frame opens a cross-site popup, and submits a form

targeting the popup. The main frame is deleted while the OpenURL IPC is

in flight, before it gets processed. The test ensures the popup receives

the navigation and is able to complete it.



This test is disabled and currently fails because the

RenderFrameProxyHost goes away after the last RenderFrameHost in its

SiteInstanceGroup goes away. As a result, the OpenURL IPC gets dropped

and the navigation doesn't happen. Once there is a mechanism to keep

the RenderFrameProxyHost alive after the RenderFrameHost is gone, this

test can be enabled.



Test: Adding a disabled test

Change-Id: Ib2614f20e750a5acb4f64e1f4753b41743a5a638

entry.title: Move sole control of backdrop-filter edge mode to compositor
entry.content:
SkiaRenderer has had support for cropping the input content to arbitrary

backdrop filters if they would read outside of the layer. It is able to

do this for all backdrop filters, whereas this removed kClamp tile mode

only affected blurs. It also did not then correctly chain with any

follow-up filters in the CSS filter list because the standalone blur

clamp tiling is configured in Skia to clamp the input and then crop

the output to transparent black. After this change, SkiaRenderer will

clamp the input to the filter list and then that is carried through

the entire list.



Bug: 41496487

Change-Id: Ic9df180fbea846c5942d0871f1d8206ba7de6e86

entry.title: Fix cookie inclusion status matcher
entry.content:
The cookie inclusion status matcher calls `MakeFromReasonsForTesting`

to create a CookieInclusionStatus with reason combination constraints,

so that the created status may silently miss some reasons from the

expected reasons, i.e. EXCLUDE_THIRD_PARTY_PHASEOUT reason will be

removed if there is other exclusion reasons.



This CL makes sure that `MakeFromReasonsForTesting` creates a status

that either contains the exact reasons for comparison; or one that

should consider combination constraints.



Change-Id: Id17a1d4ad28bfd317e2e9769dcdc3dac0eff61dd

entry.title: [E2E] Fix autofill accessory does not stay above the keyboard
entry.content:
When e2e is on, the root view (CoordinatorLayout) does not resize

because of the appearance of the keyboard. As a result, we have to

add some extra offset to accessory view.



And also because the root view does not resize when e2e is on,

onLayoutChange is not triggered when hiding keyboard. Additional

observer is introduced to observer the visibility of keyboard in

order to update the state of accessory view.



Note that this CL also affects https://crbug.com/41494990.

See comments in bug.

entry.title: [tracing] Show WaitableEvent wakeups in "toplevel.flow"
entry.content:
This is useful for scenarios where we want to track flows but don't care about tracking all wakeup reasons ("wakeup.flow" is higher throughput).



These events are only emitted for !only_used_while_idle so would only show flows

for what signaled a blocked WaitableEvent and add useful low-throughput flows to toplevel.flow



Example trace where it would have been useful:

https://snipboard.io/Gu30Tn.jpg

entry.title: Suppress racy OutputCrashKeysToStream on TSan
entry.content:
This makes sure that the (inherently) racy implementation of

OutputCrashKeysToStream is not compiled into the official build. For

TSan we then also suppress it as a known data race that won't affect a

released build.



This still races in non-official builds as threads modifying the

annotation list race with outputting the keys to stream.

entry.title: [UniversalInstall]: Fix 'Add shortcut' functionality.
entry.content:
When we show the AddToHomescreenDialogView (which handles

Install PWA and Create shortcut -- and Install Native App

for that matter), we start the installability pipeline to

check to see what kind of installation the app supports.



If the pipeline determines that the app is installable as

a PWA, it will prep the dialog to install as a PWA, even

though the pipeline may have been started to Create a

shortcut. This was fine before, but is not with Universal

Install, which gives the user an explicit choice between

installing as a PWA and creating a shortcut. If we switch

automatically to install a PWA it becomes impossible

to create a shortcut to a PWA because the Install action

takes precedence.



So, this CL is about respecting the user's choice: If they

explicitly request to create a shortcut, we should do that

and ignore the fact that it is also possible to install

the app as a PWA.



Bug: 1520511

Change-Id: I4203889e38460494b4a50ecca583d5996647ec64

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5296834

Reviewed-by: Ella Ge

Reviewed-by: Ted Choc

Commit-Queue: Finnur Thorarinsson

Reviewed-by: Glenn Hartmann

entry.title: Fix crash in ChromeTabbedActivity.handleBackPressed.
entry.content:
handleBackPressed is registered as a back press handler before

mIsHandleTabSwitcherShownEnabled is initialized. See failed CQ

run on crrev.com/c/5272471 for evidence. However, handleBackPressed

may dereference mIsHandleTabSwitcherShownEnabled, resulting in a

crash.



To fix the crash, this CL lazy-initializes

mIsHandleTabSwitcherShownEnabled when needed.

entry.title: Make BigEndianReader/Writer work with spans instead of pointer/len pairs
entry.content:
This changes the internal types to spans, and provides ReadSpan and

WriteSpan APIs and span-based constructors for callers to use, without

migrating anything.



The ReadSpan() method now returns optional instead of taking a

pointer to a span, so a couple callers are updated to the new API

shape. This matches ReadFixedSpan() and provides for a more modern

API shape. It also uses base::StrictNumeric to prevent

implicit sign change or truncation.



R=davidben@chromium.org



Bug: 40284755

entry.title: Add use counter for CSSPageRule.
entry.content:
According to the spec [1], CSSPageRule should really inherit from

CSSGroupingRule, not CSSRule. Before we make this change, though, we

should check how widely this interface is used on the web.



We only want to count CSSPageRule instances directly triggered by

scripts, and not by e.g. inspector or FrameSerializer, or via cssText on

some parent. This is why ItemInternal() is introduced alongside Item() /

item() in various CSSRule APIs.



[1] https://drafts.csswg.org/cssom/#the-csspagerule-interface



Bug: 324827379

entry.title: Reset pane root view alpha after animation.
entry.content:
This fade animation, previously added in https://crrev.com/c/5294274,

made a mistake. When the animations end, the old pane's root view is

left with an alpha value of 0. This isn't initially a problem as the

view is not shown. And when you animate back to that pane, we fade it

back in.



The problem is when you leave the hub (we skip animations) and then

re-enter the hub again (we skip animations). If the new pane was one

we previously faded to an alpha of 0, we have a problem.



To fix this we just reset the alpha to 0 after we're done with the

fade animation, to reset the state.



Bug: b/325372945

entry.title: Range::surroundContents should check text node using IsTextNode()
entry.content:
In Range::surroundsContents, the first step of the algorithm should

check if the starting/ending nodes are text node using Node::IsTextNode.

This will accounts for CDATA_SECTION_NODE, which is a text node that

inherits from Text [1].



[1] https://dom.spec.whatwg.org/#interface-cdatasection

entry.content:
This is mostly the same base change with an addition to

AXObjectCacheImpl::AddDirtyObjectToSerializationQueue.



On the test flake, despite adding dirty objects, Blink a11y never re-serialized. It looks as though, depending on when exactly PdfAccessibilityTree adds the dirty object, it may fall into post lifecycle hooks, leading to no further scheduled updates.

entry.title: Pass color provider to StyleColor::ColorFromKeyword
entry.content:
This CL is a follow up to CL:5085762. In this CL, we plumb color

providers that exist in Blink::Page to StyleColor::ColorFromKeyword

whenever possible.



The CL starts by adding an extra ColorProvider argument to the

ColorFromKeyword method and updates all of its call sites. We pass

nullptr in places where it is not possible to access the Document or

Page, similar to how a fixed light color scheme is passed in those

spots.



This CL does not use the color providers to get the system colors yet.

Next steps will see us use the passed color provider in

LayoutTheme::SystemColor and deprecate SystemColorFromNativeTheme.

entry.title: Add `TextDiffRange`
entry.content:
`CharacterData` instance methods such as `appendData`[1] has

an optimization for `LayoutText` by passing where in the text

was deleted or inserted. But different layers have slightly

different signatures, and `new_size` is lost before it reaches

`LayoutText`.



This patch adds `TextDiffRange` which represents a deletion

and/or an insertion to a string, and pass it down to

`LayoutText` and `InlineNode`.



This patch has no behavior changes.



[1] https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CharacterData

entry.title: Add gn2bp checker to CI
entry.content:
* Implemented a GN2BP validation script that would generate the desc_*.json

files on the fly during execution then run `gn2bp` script and make sure that it

executes with no error. This will allow the Cronet team to catch any changes to

the script as early as possible which decreases the time to import significantly.



* After this change, the gn2bp source of truth will be in Chromium and it should be

only used from Chromium.



* Add the new target to the CI(temporarily) until we have calculated how often

does it fail and if it's reasonable to switch it over to CQ.

entry.content:
UnmaskCardRequest for the VCN 3DS

UnmaskCardRequest for the VCN 3DS flow. If the pop-up's web contents are

destroyed, we must retrieve the most up to date URL. If the URL's query

parameters are present and they match the case that denotes the user

successfully completed the authentication, we need to trigger an

entry.title: [PIX] Handle the case of multiple PIX codes on the page.
entry.content:
Before this patch, when FacilitatedPaymentsAgent was looking up a PIX

code on the page, it picked the first string with "0014br.gov.bcb.pix"

substring and then validated it. If the code was invalid, the

FacilitatedPaymentsAgent returned the "invalid PIX code found" status

code, even if the page had a valid PIX code elsewhere, which can happen

if the page displays a truncated PIX code and has a hidden
or

with the un-truncated (valid) PIX code.



This patch adds a validator function to the

WebNode::FindTextInElementWith(substring) method to make it return the

text only if the validator returns "true" for the given text.



After this patch, if multiple PIX codes are found on the page, then the

FacilitatedPaymentsAgent returns the first _valid_ PIX code.

entry.title: Prevent ~FileUploadDelegate crash
entry.content:
`FileUploadDelegate` activity is performed on UI thread, but destructions

may be initiated from elsewhere (as generic `FileUploadJob::Delegate`

that is not associated with UI thread in any way).



To prevent DCHECK from crashing, Delegate is now always assigned to a

sequenced task runner (UI in prod), to be deleted there.



Also, additional UI-affinity checks are added.



Tested manually on VM

entry.title: [soft navigations] Nested event scopes share PerInteractionData
entry.content:
This CL makes nested EventScopes for the same SoftNavigationHeuristics

object conceptually part of the same interaction by sharing the same

PerInteractionData. This is accomplished by changing how the

last_interaction_task_id_ is managed:

- Clear it for a "new interaction" in the outermost scope, which will

be clicks, keydown, and non-nested navigate events. Note: we still

clear this as well in ResetHeuristic(), which happens when a soft

nav is detected or all pending potential soft root tasks have been

GCed.



- Set it, along with creating the PerInteractionData for the potential

soft nav, in the first event listener under any EventScope for the

interaction. If one gets created during a click/keyboard event, it

will get reused by the navigation scope. If one didn't get created

because no listeners ran, it will get created if a navigate event

listener runs.



This CL also centralizes where PerInteractionData is created.

Previously it was created in both OnCreateEventScope and

InteractionCallbackCalled, which was only called from the former.



Bug: 40942324

Change-Id: Iac162960c1209e18d8c0f75f2cbfbbc782eedcd3

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5295234

entry.title: Provide way to construct span from string literal without string_view
entry.content:
A span can be constructed to point to a string literal but excluding

the NUL terminator by going through string_view, but that is not

optimal. It can relocate the literal, and it loses the compile-time

size. Provide instead:



- span_from_cstring("hello world") to make a span, where

N is the number of characters before the NUL terminator.

- byte_span_from_cstring("hello world") to make a span

where N is the number of characters before the NUL terminator.



R=tsepez@chromium.org



Bug: 40284755

entry.title: FLEDGE: Change how tracing works for scoring multi-bid.
entry.content:
Currently, when multiple bids are generated for a single BidState due

to a k-anon re-run, trace_id_for_kanon_scoring is used to trace

the re-run's scoring. This, however, does not scale to generateBid()

returning multiple bids that need to be scored.



So instead, just use a separate trace ID (and a new "score" event_name)

for scoring every bid, no matter how many there are, and store the id in

the corresponding Bid objects.



Bug: 323856489

Change-Id: I2c4672ace095a938d8b783a752e82f1bf91bed8b

entry.title: [IdentifiabilityStudy] Add meta experiment state to StudyState
entry.content:
This CL adds a boolean to the IdentifiabilityStudyState, tracking

whether the meta experiment should be activate independently from the

rest. The activation state is synced with new renderer process upon

creation.



This is the third step to add full support for managing separately

meta experiment from the rest of the Identifiability Study, so that

the one can be enabled and the other one disabled or vice versa.

entry.content:

entry.title: Remove corb_detachable.
entry.content:
This is part of cleanup work to remove CORB code, now that its successor ORB has been enabled. This particular CL removes rarely used functionality that we won't need going forward.



This CL should be largely functionally neutral, but it affects two tests:



- One subtest in PrefetchBrowserTest: It seems the test inadvertently

relied on caching behaviour of ORB-blocked requests. By changing

the content type to the empty string the resource is not affected

by ORB at all, and the test should work as originally intended.



- WPT preload/prefetch-document: The test assertions for cross-origin

resources are not ORB compatible, because ORB would block those

resources. The change here makes us pass the test 100%; makes

Firefox (which has also implemented ORB) pass an additional subtest,

and doesn't affect WebKit (which apparently doesn't implement

prefetch).



Ref: https://wpt.fyi/results/preload/prefetch-document.html?label=master&label=experimental&aligned&q=preload%2Fprefetch-document.html

entry.title: base_perftests: Register google_benchmark tests as gtests
entry.content:
Currently BENCHMARK(BM_ReturnIfError_Ok) expands as:



static ::benchmark::internal::Benchmark*

benchmark_uniq_2_benchmark_ [[maybe_unused]] =

(::benchmark::internal::RegisterBenchmarkInternal(

new ::benchmark::internal::FunctionBenchmark(

"BM_ReturnIfError_Ok",

BM_ReturnIfError_Ok)));



This registers the benchmark function in a global instance during static

init.



The main() in run_all_perftests.cc runs all tests. It allows matching

tests via a commandline flag parsed by google_benchmark, but the

google_benchmark flags ignore gtest flags.



To run some specific test from base_perftests on Android we do:



```

autoninja -C out/AndroidReleaseOfficial base_perftests

out/AndroidReleaseOfficial/bin/run_base_perftests \

'--gtest_filter=MyBenchmark*' -v

```



This asks the binary to --gtest_list_tests before attempting to run any

existing gtest benchmark. As we learned above, google_benchmark parts

ignore this gtest flag and proceed with running all registered

benchmarks. This hits a timeout of 30 seconds on a modern device because

we hardcoded warmup to take at least 24 seconds in

big_endian_perftest.cc.



It would be nice to keep the legacy --gtest_filter interface in a

working state during transition.



As a quick fix I suggest to remove the 31 second delay by registering

the google_benchmark functions inside gtest, like so:

```

TEST(ExpectedMacrosPerfTest, BM_ReturnIfError_Ok) {

BENCHMARK(BM_ReturnIfError_Ok);

}

```



This is a change to do so for base_perftests.



Bug: b/40251982

Change-Id: Ibee0912fa1b6dfc0593bc55a54309002f9a0e950

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5300560

Reviewed-by: Peter Kasting

Commit-Queue: Egor Pasko

Reviewed-by: Lei Zhang

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1261706}

entry.title: [android] Fix generated password saved to local PasswordStore
entry.content:
Before this CL, a syncing user with UsesSplitStoresAndUPMForLocal()

true was saving generated passwords to the local store. However,

generated passwords should always be saved to a Google Account, to

avoid loss when the device is replaced. This CL fixes the bug.



The underlying issue is that the enum PasswordAccountStorageUsageLevel

exposes kUsingAccountStorage and kSyncing as 2 different things [1] and

generation was relying on this enum. With this CL, the code depends on

IsOptedInForAccountStorage() instead, which does return true for

syncing users with split stores.



Funnily, the above was the status quo before crrev.com/c/3488166. It

got changed due to a quirk: IsOptedInForAccountStorage() used to return true for syncing users who previously opted in to account storage. That

caused such users to generate to the wrong store (crbug.com/1275457).

The quirk is gone since crrev.com/c/4969376, so we can safely revert

to IsOptedInForAccountStorage() now.



Medium term, we should revisit PasswordAccountStorageUsageLevel and its

friend PasswordAccountStorageUserState. I audited current uses and the

only remaining non-metric use is [2], which I'll tackle in a separate

CL.



[1] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/password_manager/core/browser/features/password_manager_features_util.h;l=48;drc=1701fd99b91dd2ea8deb3d8744a0bbffc36d02fa

[2] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/password_manager/core/browser/sharing/password_receiver_service_impl.cc;l=289;drc=1701fd99b91dd2ea8deb3d8744a0bbffc36d02fa



Fixed: 325276671

entry.title: Ensure last TabStrip event filter resize occurs on automotive.
entry.content:
The last #onViewportChanged() doesn't seem to trigger normally, since it's comparing the new cachedVisibleViewport top with the old cachedWindowViewport top, even though that value gets zeroed out much earlier when scrolling off the top browser controls. This means that the last resize for the tab strip event filter is missed, leading to a small offset of a few pixels, with a persisting small band of the event filter that is still tappable even after the event filter is hidden.



Note that this only happens on certain screen densities, since on some other screen densities an unusual pxToDp value will ensure that (width != previousWidth) is true at every #onViewportResize(), letting it trigger correctly but for the wrong reason.



Reproduced on auto:

https://screencast.googleplex.com/cast/NjI5NzM1MTI2NTE4OTg4OHwxMjFhYThhMC0wZQ



Fixed on auto: https://screencast.googleplex.com/cast/NDc5NjU5MTE3NjE1NTEzNnw5Y2I3MTk5MC02MQ



Reproduced on Pixel with modified density:

https://screencast.googleplex.com/cast/NjA4MzYxNjUxMjY3MTc0NHw0ZmUxMzVmNS1iMw

entry.title: [bookmarks] Prefer reassigning IDs for local bookmarks over account ones
entry.content:
Normally there should be no ID collisions across two JSON files. When

they do exist (corruption state), IDs must be reassigned in at least one

of them so BookmarkModel can adhere to ID-uniqueness invariants.



Which of the two files gets the IDs reassigned is somewhat arbitrary,

but in most cases it is less harmful to reassign them to the JSON file

containing local-or-syncable bookmarks. This is because doing the same

for account bookmarks almost certainly leads to having to redownload

data from the Sync server, with its own caveats (data usage,

potentially lost local changes if pending, etc.).



There is one scenario where this "edge" case may be hit consistently:

the current plan is to eventually migrate iOS to also adopt a single

BookmarkModel instance. In this one-off transition, users will almost

certainly run into ID collisions exactly once. In this scenario, as

per rationale above, it is safer to reassign IDs for the

local-or-syncable JSON file.



Change-Id: Icc844569961a1b85de93c385a71b3dfabeace4f1

Bug: 41493391
